intro: Microseris lindleyi, commonly known as the Lindley's scabious, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, white or pale blue flowers in clusters. Microseris lindleyi is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed or sunny areas.
